reviews.text: Beautiful lobby. Marriott rewards offered a service to honor special requests for towels, pillows, reservations, etc., but ours were not honored upon arrival. I had to call desk 4 hours later. Bathroom vanity was cracked and the toilet leaked which explained the horrific B.O. smell. The only room to move to had no city view which my kids loved. From now on, I'll pack Lysol spray!
reviews.title: okay for price but renovations coming in Sept.

reviews.text: We booked the bed and breakfast for an additional $10 which was well worth it because the bill for 5 breakfast buffets would have been $51. Without a breakfast deal, go to nearby Denny's or IHOP.
reviews.title: It was decent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool was horrible and freezing eventhough the front desk insisted the heater was on. Cigarette butts were all in the pool!
reviews.title: Great service in a great city!

reviews.text: VERY convenient to West End, Galleria, historic district, etc. especially via the tollway.
reviews.title: Top Notch!!
Great Hotel Experience
reviews.text: With all the options in Dallas, I won't choose this one again. We changed our reservations for Sept. to another 4 star since the Ren. is starting "major renovations" in Sept. - beware.
This hotel is fine. The check in girl was a little snooty, but the rooms were clean with a good view. The Renaissance in Plano is much nicer.
reviews.title: Fine, but nothing special

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel because I am an elite member and have always been extremely pleased with the Marriott brands. Even after reading other negative reviews, I decided to stay here rather than at the Marriott Suites across the interstate. Although the suites had many rave reviews, I chose the Renaissance for the view and the package deal (Escape! Shopping).
reviews.title: Doesn't Meet Marriott Standards

likes.liked: — The large suite and package rate.
likes.disliked: — Almost everything else. Horrible staff, dated rooms, and nothing nearby.

reviews.text: For only $159 a night, I got an Executive Suite that included a late night snack with wine and continental breakfast. The snack had to be requested each night 30-60 minutes ahead of time and was different each night. To enjoy the continental breakfast, you had to go the hotel restaurant only to receive cereal!!!
reviews.title: Nice but just some notes...

likes.liked: — Very near convention center, comfort of room, friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Menu prices and choices, very upscale restaurant

reviews.text: Now for the service and staff of the hotel or lack thereof. Upon arrival, I was checked-in in an almost rushed fashion. There was no recognition of my elite status or welcome gift as with most other hotels. When entering the room, it was spacious, but slightly dated and worn. There were two beer caps on the floor and a rather humorous white stain on the seat of the desk chair. My request of a downtown view was not honored. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was on the small side, but amenities were wonderful. I am planning on purchasing some of the Lather products.
reviews.title: Cheesy hotel (but a good value)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On my second night in the hotel, the shower handle broke and rendered the shower unusuable. I immediately called to have it fixed. After an hour, the engineer left to look for a replacement part. We were leaving to enjoy the Saturday night and I stopped at the front desk to request a phone call if we needed to move. The rude staff informed me that I just needed to check the front desk when I got back, even if it was late and they would tell me if I needed to move. I did this and at 2am was told I would be moving. I had to request assistance with my bags!!! The only good side was that I finally got a view of downtown, but no other apologies were made for the inconvenience.
reviews.title: Love This Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a fantastic weekend in Dallas and the Renaissance. Staff were really friendly and helpful and the view from the room was simply spectacular.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: You wouldn't walk from the hotel to downtown, but it's only a few minutes away by car.
reviews.title: GET THE PACKAGE!
Wasn't disappointed at all
reviews.text: I was expecting a little bit of a dated hotel, but everything was in tip-top shape. Clean, comfortable and the staff make all the difference for me. They're happy to advise you on where to go and what to do.

reviews.title: never again
reviews.text: GET THE PACKAGES! Great price for all you get! Romance package- which includes, dinner at T-BONES which is the best STEAKS! You get appetizer, salad, entree, bread, drink, and desert. NOT ONE by the way. 2! 2 appetizers, 2 salads, etc. all included! Free breakfast buffet which is excellent! Champagne and snack. like chips salsa etc. we got the alcohol and chips at night after dinner around midnight stayed up and had fun. We wnt for my husbands birthday- and we will return! Actually already booked for Feb 08 for VDAY! Price was 249 for one night- BUT if your going for a quiet weekend alone- this is great package. we didnt need to leave the hotel! Also, 25th floor suite, with parlor room king bed. CANT BEAT it anywhere. TRUST me I looked!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travel agent Holly
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a two-night stay to visit the Texas State Fair. The location is not great (several miles from downtown) unless you have business at the nearby Market Center. We chose it for the weekend rate and location near freeway. Check-in was easy.........but flawed. We requested a king-bed room and the check-in person verified the room we were given was in fact "a king-bed room with a downtown view." NOT........ When we arrived at the room, the first thing I noticed were TWO beds. It wasn't a big deal since the room was rather large and easily accommodated the two queen beds. But, it wasn't what I asked for or was just told 5 minutes before that I was receiving. So, I went back to the lobby where I was given what I asked for. How do these things happen? The room was clean, excellent bed and bath. The breakfast buffet was decent. All-in-all a typically slightly above average business hotel. I'd stay again.
reviews.title: Great downtown view

reviews.text: Stayed here for a conference. Great view from my room on the 30th floor. Bed was comfortable, lots of fluffy towels. Room service fairly prompt, food hot and delicious.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Attractive lobby. Would love to stay here again, nice hotel.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

likes.liked: — Nice hotel staff and good atmosphere in hotel
likes.disliked: — The beef smell in the lobby!

reviews.text: We stayed for a long weekend coming from Washington, DC to see the Cowboys game during home opening weekend. The hotel is close to Texas Stadium and the West end area of Dallas. The hotel staff was very efficient and helpful. Hotel looks great from the outside and the lobby, bar and restaurant area had an upscale feel without being pretentious at all. The rooms are standard but very clean and it is nice to have two sink areas when staying with two people. The bed was very comfortable--down comforter and lots of pillows. TV is small. Room service offers a fairly good selection but as always, a bit pricey. We had a room on the 23rd floor and the view of downtown was great. Try Breadwinners cafe and bakery on McKinney for brunch or breakfast, its a great cafe/lunch place that tons of locals seem to frequent. You will have to wait but it was worth it. The only (-) of this hotel was that the lobby smelled strangely like beef. This is because of the steakhouse on the main floor but it is a weird combination of hotel cleaner smell mixed with beef every time you walk in....maybe they could get a better venting system in that restaurant. Other than that it was a great hotel and I would stay there again. Also--free parking. Get a rental car or you will feel isolated. Go Cowboys!
reviews.title: Granite and glass monolyth

likes.liked: — Free Parking / View of downtown Dallas

reviews.text: I had a 3 night mid-week stay.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended
